helpdesk-ticket.subject: RE: IT Services Update - my.msoe.edu Services Restored
helpdesk-ticket.description:
IT Department,
I am unable to see my Financial Aid Information which I NEED TO SEE. It goes to a server error screen when I click the Financial Aid link from my.msoe.edu site which it quite annoying. It says below the link I need to registrar my account if I have not done so to see my Financial Aid Information, however, when I click on this link it leads me to a false website as well which is just as annoying. Regardless, I have registered my account on the Hub previously as I am a current sophomore and I have been able to see my Financial Aid Award around 1 ½ months ago.
The annoying screens are attached in this email. Is my.msoe.edu still not working?
Please help me resolve this issue, I look forward to a quick fix as is usual in the MSOE IT Department ;)
Thanks,
Caleb Klaty From: Helpdesk Sent: Monday, December 28, 2015 11:53 AM Subject: IT Services Update - my.msoe.edu Services Restored Importance: High
[cid:image001.png@01D14CC1.F22ED690]
MSOE Community:
Maintenance has completed on my.msoe.edu. Services, including payments and pay stubs, have been restored.
Please contact the Helpdesk with any support questions or issues.
No MSOE IT employees nor any MSOE IT correspondence will ever ask you for your account password.
Information Technology (IT) Phone: 414-277-7288 Web (including FAQ’s): http://www.msoe.edu/community/campus-life/student-resources/information-technology-department-it Enter a Help Request: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu Helpdesk Hours Campus Center Great Room Monday – Thursday: 7:30 a.m. - 7:00 p.m. Friday: 7:30 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Saturday - Sunday: 10:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Summer Hours Mon-Fri 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Constant lock outs in the morning
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Julie Snyder signs into windows initially in the morning with no problems, anything after that is locked out. From what I can see it looks to be a remote access that is causing the lockout. Can we follow up with Julie to try and find the cause of this?
Office CC436-437 (Student Accounts)
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Julie Snyder signs into windows initially in the morning with no problems, anything after that is locked out. From what I can see it looks to be a remote access that is causing the lockout. Can we follow up with Julie to try and find the cause of this?

Office CC436-437 (Student Accounts)

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Julie,
We spoke on the phone. I wanted to send a message to clarify what is going to happen with this ticket. When we spoke this morning about the possible causes, you mentioned that you do not have email set up on your phone. This helps us narrow down causes because often one of the causes of lockouts is devices (phones, tablets, etc.) that are trying to access MSOE email or other MSOE services (wireless internet, VPN, community), with bad credentials.
Something that would help us narrow this issue down would be if you could check your saved passwords in your browser for possibly bad credentials. Here are some ways to do this with the common browsers. It would really help if you could go through your saved passwords in your browser and try to update anything MSOE related that is saved.
Please update us with any other pertinent information. I want to have someone from IT give you a visit to try and troubleshoot this. Can you reply to this message with some times during the week that you are available to be helped with this?
Have a great day!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hey Julie,

We spoke on the phone. I wanted to send a message to clarify what is going to happen with this ticket. When we spoke this morning about the possible causes, you mentioned that you do not have email set up on your phone. This helps us narrow down causes because often one of the causes of lockouts is devices (phones, tablets, etc.) that are trying to access MSOE email or other MSOE services (wireless internet, VPN, community), with bad credentials. 

Something that would help us narrow this issue down would be if you could check your saved passwords in your browser for possibly bad credentials. Here are some ways to do this with the common browsers. It would really help if you could go through your saved passwords in your browser and try to update anything MSOE related that is saved. 

Please update us with any other pertinent information. I want to have someone from IT give you a visit to try and troubleshoot this. Can you reply to this message with some times during the week that you are available to be helped with this? 

Have a great day!

thank you
________________________________ From: fimservice@msoe.edu <fimservice@msoe.edu> Sent: Tuesday, January 12, 2016 1:00 AM To: Seidel, Scott; SysAdmin Subject: Account Disable Warning for Scott Seidel
Dear Scott,
Your MSOE accounts are set to disable on (01/20/2016). Please make sure you have all of your emails and files backed up as you will lose access to them once your account is disabled.
If you are an alumni, we encourage you to register for an alumni account through Google Apps by going to https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/.
MSOE Alumni Account Creation<https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/> gapps.msoe.edu MSOE is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and a member of the North Central Association (800) 621-7440, (www.ncahlc.org). Additional program accreditation ...
If you would like to continue to follow MSOE on the Hub, please switch your Hub account from your MSOE account to a personal email address, or your alumni email address by going to http://hubswitcher.msoe.edu.
If you have any questions please contact the Help Desk by opening a ticket at http://helpdesk.msoe.edu or call 414-277-7288.
Thank You

helpdesk-note.body: User is expected to graduate on Feb 27 2016. Can we check if his account will remain active until then?
helpdesk-note.body-html: User is expected to graduate on Feb 27 2016. Can we check if his account will remain active until then?

helpdesk-note.body:
User is not registered for classes, but is finishing up an incomplete and needs access to his account until the end of this quarter.
Peter mentioned something about enrolling him in a zero credit hour course created by his program director, but I am sure Michael Timm will know more about what needs to be done in this instance.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
User is not registered for classes, but is finishing up an incomplete and needs access to his account until the end of this quarter. 

Peter mentioned something about enrolling him in a zero credit hour course created by his program director, but I am sure Michael Timm will know more about what needs to be done in this instance.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Scott,
In order to keep your account active you will need to be registered for classes. In your case, the best option would be to enroll in a Graduate Continuation coarse. It is specifically designed for this very situation you are in. Its zero credits and doesn't cost any money to take, all you have to do is walk into Registrars (or call) and request to be put in the coarse. Also you might have to have your program director sign off on it. If you have any other questions, feel free to email us back.
Best, Sam West MSOE IT Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4518

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Unable to send class email from Mymsoe
helpdesk-ticket.assoc-problem: unable to email class lists in my.msoe
helpdesk-ticket.description: I receive an "internal server" error message when trying to send a class email from Mymsoe, so I am currently unable to send the an class email from my Class List.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: I receive an "internal server" error message when trying to send a class email from Mymsoe, so I am currently unable to send the an class email from my Class List.

helpdesk-note.body:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors. As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:
Copy and paste the class roster from the my.msoe email and paste it into Outlook or Black Board and send email from there. This continues to leverage the up to date rosters from my.msoe but works around the email problem with a manual step.
I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.
I appreciate your patience and your time.
Peter Pfister Help Desk Coordinator 414.277.7202
helpdesk-note.body-html:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors.  As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:

I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.

I appreciate your patience and your time.

helpdesk-ticket.description: Good Morning! I would like to install SPSS onto my laptop. I did check the Programs and Features on the Control Panel, but I am not finding it (unless it's labelled something else and I'm unaware). Please let me know if there's a process I should follow, and thank you for your assistance! -Jennifer Abing
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Good Morning! 

I would like to install SPSS onto my laptop.  I did check the Programs and Features on the Control Panel, but I am not finding it (unless it's labelled something else and I'm unaware).  Please let me know if there's a process I should follow, and thank you for your assistance!

-Jennifer Abing

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Jennifer,
Double check to make sure you are connected to MSOE wireless and not the guest channel.
Also I am attaching a document in this email that I created on how to successfully install SPSS 22. Let me know if you have any issues when trying to install the software or if the program itself is still not showing up in the get programs list.
Best Regards, Sam West MSOE IT - Assistant Systems Administrator

Rob

helpdesk-note.body: I have tried for about 30 minutes now to replicate the issue and have not had success (the system works fine). The cable appears to be fine as well. Might it have something to do with an automatic shut off on the computer if it is not used over a certain time?

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Problem with .pst files connecting with Outlook
helpdesk-ticket.description: Sandra Everts in the lower level of the APC is having issues syncing her .pst outlook backup files into her current outlook. This seems to have been caused somehow by the actions of Box Sync changing certain file locations. She requests help from IT as soon as possible because the information in those files is pertinent to her job at the moment.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Sandra Everts in the lower level of the APC is having issues syncing her .pst outlook backup files into her current outlook. This seems to have been caused somehow by the actions of Box Sync changing certain file locations. She requests help from IT as soon as possible because the information in those files is pertinent to her job at the moment.

helpdesk-note.body:
Sandra,
Try moving the PST files off of Box and syncing them locally. I don't think you can use a PST file from within Box. I'll leave this ticket open so the Helpdesk can circle back if I'm wrong.
Thanks,
Paul Fabian Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4530

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Request for speaker phone in classroom.
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello, I am teaching a professional guidance course on Monday afternoons from 4-4:50 in CC 48. For Weeks 7, 8, and 9, I need a speaker phone set up for people to call and conduct phone interviews with my students. The speaker is necessary so everyone can hear the exchange. I would like to have the calls begin by 4:10, no later. Can you do this? And if so, can you give me the same phone number every week so I can give the same number to all my callers? Thanks, Margaret Dwyer, General Studies
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello,
I am teaching a professional guidance course on Monday afternoons from 4-4:50 in CC 48. For Weeks 7, 8, and 9, I need a speaker phone set up for people to call and conduct phone interviews with my students. The speaker is necessary so everyone can hear the exchange.
I would like to have the calls begin by 4:10, no later.
Can you do this? And if so, can you give me the same phone number every week so I can give the same number to all my callers?
Thanks,
Margaret Dwyer, General Studies

helpdesk-note.body: Moving to AV
helpdesk-note.body-html: Moving to AV

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Margaret,
I would be happy to help with this. We have a conference speaker phone available. Larry Palank is using it in CC50 Monday nights starting at 6:00 PM, so when you are finished each night it can just go right there. I can meet with you beforehand to go over logistics and show you how to use it. Is there a good time next week to meet?
Sincerely,
Andy Holmes Instructional Technology x6765 Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4555

Hi Margaret,
 
I would be happy to help with this.  We have a conference speaker phone available.  Larry Palank is using it in CC50 Monday nights starting at 6:00 PM, so when you are finished each night it can just go right there.  I can meet with you beforehand to go over logistics and show you how to use it.  Is there a good time next week to meet?
 
Sincerely,
 
Andy Holmes
Instructional Technology
x6765

helpdesk-ticket.subject: HD Failure
helpdesk-ticket.description: User came in reporting multiple BSODs. He also stated that he ran an HD test and it failed. He requested that we help him back up his data before we fix the HD problem.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: User came in reporting multiple BSODs. He also stated that he ran an HD test and it failed. He requested that we help him back up his data before we fix the HD problem.

helpdesk-note.body: His computer would not boot into Windows. Used the USB Linux drive to boot his computer in Linux. We then were able to plug an an external HD that he brought and transfer his files over. The next step will be to swap in a stock HD from unit 36786 and transfer his files back.
helpdesk-note.body-html: His computer would not boot into Windows. Used the USB Linux drive to boot his computer in Linux. We then were able to plug an an external HD that he brought and transfer his files over. The next step will be to swap in a stock HD from unit 36786 and transfer his files back.

helpdesk-note.body: Cannot find all necessary files using Linux boot. User is going to hold on to the computer for now until he can get at his files more accurately.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Cannot find all necessary files using Linux boot. User is going to hold on to the computer for now until he can get at his files more accurately.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Computer crash with security camera use
helpdesk-ticket.description: The user has an interface on her computer with the GEA security system and when she uses it with other programs running, her computer crashes. She only has 1 RAM stick in her computer.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: The user has an interface on her computer with the GEA security system and when she uses it with other programs running, her computer crashes. She only has 1 RAM stick in her computer.

helpdesk-note.body: sending to tier 2
helpdesk-note.body-html: sending to tier 2

helpdesk-note.body:
I doubt its a ram issue, probably overtemp from dust or something. Assuming these are the cisco cameras, the camera software does 264 decode on the local box so its quite intensive, specifically if you are looking at a bunch of cameras at once. try dusting the hsf and watching coretemp. If not try with a rotating 1 or 2 display at a time setup vs 4-6-8 at a time.
Tony
helpdesk-note.body-html:
I doubt its a ram issue, probably overtemp from dust or something. Assuming these are the cisco cameras, the camera software does 264 decode on the local box so its quite intensive, specifically if you are looking at a bunch of cameras at once. try dusting the hsf and watching coretemp. If not try with a rotating 1 or 2 display at a time setup vs 4-6-8 at a time. 

Tony

helpdesk-note.body:

helpdesk-note.body:
Bryan,
Thanks for doing your due diligence on this and not just resetting the password because the caller gets angry. I don't know if she's legit or not, but the angry customer routine is one of the tried and true social engineering methods to get people to give in and reset a password for a stranger. if she is legitimate, we can work on a method to make it easier for her... after she's been verified.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Bryan,

Thanks for doing your due diligence on this and not just resetting the password because the caller gets angry. I don't know if she's legit or not, but the angry customer routine is one of the tried and true social engineering methods to get people to give in and reset a password for a stranger. if she is legitimate, we can work on a method to make it easier for her... after she's been verified.

helpdesk-note.body: Customer is Air Force ROTC liaison to MSOE. Just wanted to make sure that was clear. - Tyler Clark
helpdesk-note.body-html: Customer is Air Force ROTC liaison to MSOE. Just wanted to make sure that was clear. - Tyler Clark

helpdesk-note.body:
Nick,
Bryan already left a voicemail for you regarding this ticket, but I wanted to offer some detail. Under normal circumstances, we don't provide "@msoe.edu" email accounts to users outside the university. I have to assume this account is older and predates the current administration. However, since it is not associated to a user, we have no way to verify proper ownership of the account.
Apparently, this user is upset, and wants someone to call her. If we could discuss proper protocol before she is contacted, it may make things easier for her in the future. For example, we could forward this account to her own official Air Force ROTC email account, so mail bound for this account goes to her, but she would respond from an Air Force account, and not an MSOE account. This would remove the need for her to ever require a password change, and would meet our requirements of not allowing a non-MSOE user access to send emails from this address.
I'm available at x2355 if you can give me a call before contacting Arlene. I'm certain we can come up with a solution that meets our security procedures and keeps the user from needing to call and reset her password, and deal with account verification she cannot provide.
Thanks,
Paul Fabian
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Nick, 

Bryan already left a voicemail for you regarding this ticket, but I wanted to offer some detail. Under normal circumstances, we don't provide "@msoe.edu" email accounts to users outside the university. I have to assume this account is older and predates the current administration. However, since it is not associated to a user, we have no way to verify proper ownership of the account. 

Apparently, this user is upset, and wants someone to call her. If we could discuss proper protocol before she is contacted, it may make things easier for her in the future. For example, we could forward this account to her own official Air Force ROTC email account, so mail bound for this account goes to her, but she would respond from an Air Force account, and not an MSOE account. This would remove the need for her to ever require a password change, and would meet our requirements of not allowing a non-MSOE user access to send emails from this address.

I'm available at x2355 if you can give me a call before contacting Arlene. I'm certain we can come up with a solution that meets our security procedures and keeps the user from needing to call and reset her password, and deal with account verification she cannot provide.

Thanks,

Paul Fabian

helpdesk-note.body-html: password reset to MSOE7682!

helpdesk-note.body:
Nick,
We've set Arlene's password and I will contact her and let her know what it is, but we couldn't determine a secure way to set it without needing to verify her credentials at the helpdesk. Her account isn't linked to Jenzebar like an MSOE employee would be, and since she is not a student or a paid employee, we don't have her personal info (nor are we comfortable asking for it just so she can send email).
If your department can act as her contact point when she needs a password reset, we meet the requirements for the email address - that it's managed by an MSOE entity. Arlene can call your team, who can call or email the helpdesk to have the account reset.
Let me know if this is an acceptable compromise, and I'll contact Arlene with the new password.
Thanks,
Paul Fabian

helpdesk-note.body: Sent to System Admin
helpdesk-note.body-html: Sent to System Admin

helpdesk-note.body: Talked to mark, he is going to stop by around 4 to let us know who we should transfer them too
helpdesk-note.body-html: Talked to mark, he is going to stop by around 4 to let us know who we should transfer them too

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Mark,
The folders that are in Donna's Box account she is a co-owner or editor of that folder along with someone else. For example she is a editor of the ESL DEPARTMENT folder which you are the owner of. Here are the folders that are in her Box account
ESL DEPARTMENT - Mark Anderson Owner Title IX Steering Committe - Kip Kussman Owner Quarterly Slides - Tim Valley Owner Director meeting minutes - Tim Valley Owner Pictures of Regents - Dana Grennier Owner Regent reports - Tim Valley Owner
I am thinking that we should not mess with the permissions on these folders as the owners probably have them set the way they want them.
When an employee leaves it is up to the manager to request access to that employees email, Box account, H drive etc. They get an email informing them of this once the employee's account is disabled.
Mike Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4567
Should these be turned over to Tim Valley? What process is there for Box folders when employees leave?
Mark Anderson
Director of International Programs & Services
andersonm@msoe.edu
414.277.4544 Office
414.581.4457 Cell
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Mark,

The folders that are in Donna's Box account she is a co-owner or editor of that folder along with someone else.  For example she is a editor of the ESL DEPARTMENT folder which you are the owner of.  Here are the folders that are in her Box account

ESL DEPARTMENT - Mark Anderson Owner
Title IX Steering Committe - Kip Kussman Owner
Quarterly Slides - Tim Valley Owner
Director meeting minutes - Tim Valley Owner
Pictures of Regents - Dana Grennier Owner
Regent reports - Tim Valley Owner

I am thinking that we should not mess with the permissions on these folders as the owners probably have them set the way they want them. 

When an employee leaves it is up to the manager to request access to that employees email, Box account, H drive etc.  They get an email informing them of this once the employee's account is disabled.

Mike

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4567
Should these be turned over to Tim Valley?  What process is there for Box folders when employees leave?
 
Mark Anderson
Director of International Programs & Services
andersonm@msoe.edu
414.277.4544 Office
414.581.4457 Cell

helpdesk-note.body: Hi Mike, That is fine if she is the co-owner just to have her permissions removed and leave it like is, or you could make sure that Tim becomes a co-owner in Donna’s place. Otherwise, if Donna was the owner, then it would be good to give ownership to Tim. Thanks! Mark
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Mike,
  That is fine if she is the co-owner just to have her permissions removed and leave it like is, or you could make sure that Tim becomes a co-owner in Donna’s place.  Otherwise, if Donna was the owner, then it would be good to give ownership to Tim.
Thanks!
Mark

Hi knapkiewicz, Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4577
I apologize for the dealy, as it seems there was a miscommunication on my end. If you are able to stop by the Helpdesk located on the CC 3rd floor we will be happy to swap the chargers with you, otherwise, if you provide a list of times that you are available from 1/18 - 1/22 we will make sure someone can stop by to drop off the charger.
Thanks,
Thomas Schleich helpdesk@msoe.edu 414-277-7288

Larry Fennigkoh, Ph.D., P.E.
Professor,  Biomedical Engineering
Milwaukee School of Engineering
EECS Dept.
1025 N. Broadway
Milwaukee, WI 53202

helpdesk-note.body:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors. As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:
Copy and paste the class roster from the my.msoe email and paste it into Outlook or Black Board and send email from there. This continues to leverage the up to date rosters from my.msoe but works around the email problem with a manual step.
I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.
I appreciate your patience and your time.
Peter Pfister Help Desk Coordinator 414.277.7202
helpdesk-note.body-html:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors.  As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:

I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Test Ticket
helpdesk-ticket.description: Test ticket description
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Test ticket description

helpdesk-note.body:
Hello Donna,
This is the ticket that was created as an example ticket. Anyways, emailing helpdesk@msoe.edu to is probably the easiest way to create an IT ticket. You can also call MSOE IT at (414) 277-7288 and we can create tickets for you. Another way to create tickets is to log onto https://community.msoe.edu and click on the "My News" button, and then click on "IT Tickets button" This is also where you can check on current tickets. Feel free to contact us with any questions.
Have a great day!
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hello Donna,

This is the ticket that was created as an example ticket. Anyways, emailing helpdesk@msoe.edu to is probably the easiest way to create an IT ticket. 
You can also call MSOE IT at (414) 277-7288 and we can create tickets for you.
Another way to create tickets is to log onto https://community.msoe.edu and click on the "My News" button, and then click on "IT Tickets button" This is also where you can check on current tickets.
Feel free to contact us with any questions.

Have a great day!

helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hello
I would like to consolidate our email boxes. Right now we have the following email boxes:
SUMMERPROGRAMS@MSOE.EDU PLTWWI@MSOE.EDU<mailto:PLTWWI@MSOE.EDU> PRECOLLEGE@MSOE.EDU<mailto:PRECOLLEGE@MSOE.EDU> STEM@MSOE.EDU
I would like all of these emails to remain (as they are all over our marketing material) but I would like them to forward to one main email box STEM@MSOE.EDU<mailto:STEM@MSOE.EDU>.
The following people need access to this STEM@MSOE.EDU<mailto:STEM@MSOE.EDU> box:
Joshua Schultz Carly Uuskallio Patricia Deibert Marv Bollman Corrine Sanford Annalyssa Martin Bryant Holland Alaina Auton Michael Meilicke

helpdesk-ticket.subject: MSOE Library Proxy Server
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hi Support, When you have a chance, would you please make the following the changes to the library's EZProxy Server config.txt file (see below)? helpdesk-ticket.subject: phone
helpdesk-ticket.description: Yesterday the Red Hat squad came by and looked at my phone and found that there was a faulty connection in the phone. They said that there would be a replacement phone, but so far that has not yet happened. In addition, my phone has said and continues to say that it is not registered so I am unable to make calls or use the hardline for internet so I am unable to log on to Jenzabar. I need to be able to call students and ensure that I have everything ready to go for midterms. Thanks you.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Yesterday the Red Hat squad came by and looked at my phone and found that there was a faulty connection in the phone. They said that there would be a replacement phone, but so far that has not yet happened. In addition, my phone has said and continues to say that it is not registered so I am unable to make calls or use the hardline for internet so I am unable to log on to Jenzabar. I need to be able to call students and ensure that I have everything ready to go for midterms. Thanks you.

helpdesk-note.body: Dont send up tickets without notes please. I talked to Peter and Thomas about this, minimally, it likely needs a cable.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Dont send up tickets without notes please. I talked to Peter and Thomas about this, minimally, it likely needs a cable.

helpdesk-note.body: We were there yesterday and tested the cable. It seems to be the jack in the back of the phone. It seems like the pins of the jack are loose. The issue only happens when he moves the phone. If he sets the phone with the cord in the correct position it works briefly.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
We were there yesterday and tested the cable. It seems to be the jack in the back of the phone. It seems like the pins of the jack are loose. 
The issue only happens when he moves the phone. If he sets the phone with the cord in the correct position it works briefly.

helpdesk-note.body: I can confirm what Cameron said. I personally re-terminated the cable and still had to wiggle it and push it farther into the phone to get it to turn on. There is not an issue with the cable: it is a problem with the phone. I am moving this back up to the hardware team.
helpdesk-note.body-html: I can confirm what Cameron said. I personally re-terminated the cable and still had to wiggle it and push it farther into the phone to get it to turn on. There is not an issue with the cable: it is a problem with the phone. I am moving this back up to the hardware team.

helpdesk-note.body:
I cloned a phone for him so it can be swapped. Need someone to grab it from my office and take it over to him.
Thanks, Tony
helpdesk-note.body-html:
I cloned a phone for him so it can be swapped. Need someone to grab it from my office and take it over to him.

Thanks,
Tony

helpdesk-note.body:
Abby thinks this was resolved with a cable. I can see the original phone is currently registered correctly in call manager so this seems reasonable. If so, whoever fixed it please resolve this ticket. If not I will keep the cloned phone on my back desk so if he needs it someone can just grab it and swap it.
Tony
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Abby thinks this was resolved with a cable. I can see the original phone is currently registered correctly in call manager so this seems reasonable. If so, whoever fixed it please resolve this ticket. If not I will keep the cloned phone on my back desk so if he needs it someone can just grab it and swap it.

Tony

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Outlook not Searching Emails
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Dr. Paliwal can type anything into the search field and hit enter. Outlook continues to display "Searching..." with no results to show. I had him navigate to Search Tools - > Indexing status which showed that outlook had ten thousand items waiting to be indexed. He told me that he would call the desk after an hour or so to update any progress on outlook indexing his files.
Ben Mahon Tier 1 Technician

helpdesk-note.body:
Beth, Is the user getting this error in the GL Account Lookup portlet? If so, we have logged tracking # 51303 for this issue. Let me know and I will add MSOE to the list of clients who have encountered this issue.
OK. I will add you to the list of clients who have encountered this issue. The only workaround we have found is to export smaller datasets. 25 rows or less usually works.
Thanks. Diana

Diana

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Account Disable Warning
helpdesk-ticket.description: Hello - I do not have classes this quarter and my accounts are set to expire on 1/20/16. I have to take a class in the Spring, so how will registration work if I do not have an account? Can you please change my status so that it will not expire? I will need to use it 4 weeks after it is disabled to register for classes, so it seems illogical to disable it for that short amount of time. (I'm VP of a student org (Tau Alpha Pi) if that will be another reason to bend the rules for the student account extension...) Thanks, Aubrey
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello -

I do not have classes this quarter and my accounts are set to expire on 1/20/16. I have to take a class in the Spring, so how will registration work if I do not have an account? Can you please change my status so that it will not expire? I will need to use it 4 weeks after it is disabled to register for classes, so it seems illogical to disable it for that short amount of time.
(I'm VP of a student org (Tau Alpha Pi) if that will be another reason to bend the rules for the student account extension...)

Thanks,
Aubrey

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi oneilla,
Sadly, there is not a way for us to extend the expiration of your email account. In order to register for classes in the Spring you will need to directly contact the Registrar who will assist you with the process at that time. I apologize for the inconvenience.
Is there anything else I can assist you with today?

Thanks, Aubrey

When outlook reads "Something went wrong when attaching one drive to business", you should still be able to click on an icon on the left hand side of the same window labeled "Computer" to access the File Explorer on your computer. The button is shown in the attached file.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Pat,
Thank you for the follow up!
I double-checked my classroom assignment on the MSOE Home Portal, and it is CC-53 (and is located as you described). I am part-time and on campus only Tuesday and Thursday nights.
In class last night, I could not get the cable to plug in to my laptop, and looking at the connector, one pin was broke (half the length of the other pins). We moved to another classroom. I suppose someone could have been able to bend the connector enough to get it to fit. The connector looked pretty rough though.
Dianne
________________________________
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Pat,

Thank you for the follow up!

I double-checked my classroom assignment on the MSOE Home Portal, and it is CC-53 (and is located as you described). I am part-time and on campus only Tuesday and Thursday nights.

In class last night, I could not get the cable to plug in to my laptop, and looking at the connector, one pin was broke (half the length of the other pins). We moved to another classroom. I suppose someone could have been able to bend the connector enough to get it to fit. The connector looked pretty rough though.

Dianne

helpdesk-note.body:
I am sort of just the middle man trying to help Public Safety get what they needed to go live today. Russell Bozicevich in Public Safety is the lead on this.
It doesn’t have to do with them getting a new computer as has been brought up by the helpdesk in the past. This is a separate thing. They got a new software, Competitive Edge (I think is the name), and they were looking to pre-populate student information into the system. I gave them a spreadsheet and I believe they are working on uploading or cutting/pasting that data into the system. However, the concern is that the information (current students, addresses, etc) will become out of date quickly and there must be a better way to periodically upload data. That is where IT’s help is needed.
I believe Jen is aware of the project, but I am not sure if they have connected with each other.
Mary
Mary Nielsen Registrar Milwaukee School of Engineering
helpdesk-note.body-html:

I believe Jen is aware of the project, but I am not sure if they have connected with each other.
 
Mary

Milwaukee School of Engineering

helpdesk-note.body:
That's correct. All I need is an export onto an excel spreadsheet with names, addresses, DOBs, and phone number of all Faculty, Staff, and students at MSOE. The spreadsheet from the Registrar's Office containing the contact information of all students, was successfully copied and pasted to the spreadsheet used by the vendor to import into the system. We must use their spreadsheet or the import won't work. The export from the Registrar's Office worked perfectly and I'm currently working with HR for the same information on all Faculty and Staff. I'm looking for a quicker and easier way to export all the information without bothering different departments. Either IT could send me the export once a quarter or I can furnish a copy of the Import Contact spreadsheet so IT can copy and paste the data for me so I can import it into the system.
Russell Bozicevich Sergeant Department of Public Safety 1025 N. Broadway Milwaukee WI, 53202 414.277.7169 bozicevich@msoe.edu
________________________________
helpdesk-note.body-html:
That's correct.  All I need is an export onto an excel spreadsheet with names, addresses, DOBs, and phone number of all Faculty, Staff, and students at MSOE.  The spreadsheet from the Registrar's Office containing the contact information of all students, was successfully copied and pasted to the spreadsheet used by the vendor to import into the system.  We must use their spreadsheet or the import won't work.  The export from the Registrar's Office worked perfectly and I'm currently working with HR for the same information on all Faculty and Staff.  I'm looking for a quicker and easier way to export all the information without bothering different departments.  Either IT could send me the export once a quarter or I can furnish a copy of the Import Contact spreadsheet so IT can copy and paste the data for me so I can import it into the system.  

Russell Bozicevich
Sergeant
Department of Public Safety
1025 N. Broadway
Milwaukee WI, 53202
414.277.7169
bozicevich@msoe.edu

helpdesk-note.body:
Beth and I talked to Russ. He will send us a ticket each quarter asking for this information. I will find the reports that Mary used (for student info) and HR used (for staff/faculty info) and send the information to Russ as an excel sheet when it is requested.
If the quarterly information ends up being too out-of-date throughout the quarter, we might want to consider sharing a report to Russ' workspace for him to run whenever he needs to.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Beth and I talked to Russ. He will send us a ticket each quarter asking for this information. I will find the reports that Mary used (for student info) and HR used (for staff/faculty info) and send the information to Russ as an excel sheet when it is requested. 

If the quarterly information ends up being too out-of-date throughout the quarter, we might want to consider sharing a report to Russ' workspace for him to run whenever he needs to.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Network printer issue
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hello,
We have a Xerox network printer in the CBM that is also our scanner and copier and is currently not functional. It is reporting an error that requires a restart but that does not appear to be fixing the problem. We would appreciate it if someone from IT could take a look at it.
Thank you,
Diane H. Munzenmaier, PhD Program Director, Professional Development in STEM Education Center for BioMolecular Modeling, Milwaukee School of Engineering Milwaukee, WI 53202 414-277-2805 munzenmaier@msoe.edu<mailto:munzenmaier@msoe.edu> http://cbm.msoe.edu/index.php

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4642

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I will elevate this to our tier 2 team. We will send a tier 2 tech down to take a look at it sometime next week.
Have a great weekend.



Thanks,
MSOE Information Technology
Tier 2 Staff Support
Cameron Wilson
414-277-7288
helpdesk@msoe.edu

On Fri, 15 Jan at 2:03 pm , munzenmaier <munzenmaier@msoe.edu> wrote:
Hello,
 
We have a Xerox network printer in the CBM that is also our scanner and copier and is currently not functional.  It is reporting an error that requires a restart but that does not appear to be fixing the problem.  We would appreciate it if someone from IT could take a look at it.
 
Thank you,
 
Diane H. Munzenmaier, PhD
Program Director, Professional Development in STEM Education
Center for BioMolecular Modeling, Milwaukee School of Engineering
Milwaukee, WI 53202
414-277-2805
munzenmaier@msoe.edu
http://cbm.msoe.edu/index.php

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Sheila Barber,
From what I can see there does not seem to be any bad password attempts in that last few days for your account. To me, this seems to be an issue with connecting to the network physically. Are you on wireless when this happens? Do you have access to other servers when this is happening? Can you access the internet?
Regardless, there are a few "work around" solutions that might fix your issue permanently without relying on any local servers. (I'm assuming it is not essential that you have your files on the O drive, as I am not entirely aware of your situation).
You could use your MSOE provided Box account to store up to 20GB of files that would be accessible from any computer or internet accessible device you own. These files can be shared with others easily and are secure. You can set up your box account at box.msoe.edu. You could use OneDrive for Business (Microsoft's cloud storage) with your MSOE credentials to store up to a terabyte (last time I checked) of files, which would function similar to Box or Google Drive.
Both of these solutions would need some initial setup. Feel free to contact the Helpdesk for help with this.
I completely understand that you may be accustomed to using the O drive, or you might not have a choice. I just wanted to provide some possible solutions for you. We always try to emphasize the importance of backing up your data. Cloud storage providers are an easy and secure way to do that.
Have a great day!
MSOE IT Helpdesk Technician Justin
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Sheila Barber,

From what I can see there does not seem to be any bad password attempts in that last few days for your account. To me, this seems to be an issue with connecting to the network physically. Are you on wireless when this happens? Do you have access to other servers when this is happening? Can you access the internet? 

Regardless, there are a few "work around" solutions that might fix your issue permanently without relying on any local servers. (I'm assuming it is not essential that you have your files on the O drive, as I am not entirely aware of your situation).
  • You could use your MSOE provided Box account to store up to 20GB of files that would be accessible from any computer or internet accessible device you own. These files can be shared with others easily and are secure. You can set up your box account at box.msoe.edu.
  • You could use OneDrive for Business (Microsoft's cloud storage) with your MSOE credentials to store up to a terabyte (last time I checked) of files, which would function similar to Box or Google Drive. 
Both of these solutions would need some initial setup. Feel free to contact the Helpdesk for help with this. 

I completely understand that you may be accustomed to using the O drive, or you might not have a choice. I just wanted to provide some possible solutions for you. We always try to emphasize the importance of backing up your data. Cloud storage providers are an easy and secure way to do that. 

Have a great day!

MSOE IT Helpdesk Technician Justin

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi verstegenm,
Do you have GlobalProtect installed and updated on your laptop? GlobalProtect provides a VPN service that allows you to connect to the MSOE domain from any internet connection. If you don't have this, let us know and we can provide instructions on how to install it. helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi verstegenm,

Do you have GlobalProtect installed and updated on your laptop? GlobalProtect provides a VPN service that allows you to connect to the MSOE domain from any internet connection. If you don't have this, let us know and we can provide instructions on how to install it.

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4668
Sorry, im studying in Germany right now so I cant cannect to MSOE servers to reset my password. Could you please reset it for me.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hello Matthew,
Your password has been reset to the default: Msoe######MMDDYY where ###### is your six digit student ID number and MMDDYY is your birthday.
The password into your laptop will have some trouble updating. To resolve this, you will have to connect to the MSOE network via GlobalProtect (connect using the default password.) Once connected, you should be prompted to log off the computer then log in with the updated credentials.
If you need help changing the password please let me know. Thank you, Abby Griffin
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hello Matthew,

Your password has been reset to the default:  Msoe######MMDDYY where ###### is your six digit student ID number and MMDDYY is your birthday. 

The password into your laptop will have some trouble updating. To resolve this, you will have to connect to the MSOE network via GlobalProtect (connect using the default password.) Once connected, you should be prompted to log off the computer then log in with the updated credentials.

If you need help changing the password please let me know.
Thank you,
Abby Griffin

helpdesk-ticket.subject: GlobalProtect Will Not Connect
helpdesk-ticket.description: User was having trouble getting GlobalProtect to connect.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: User was having trouble getting GlobalProtect to connect.

helpdesk-note.body:
First instinct was to have him install the most recent update via https://sslvpn.msoe.edu. GlobalProtect doesn't always function properly when it isn't updated.
While doing this, we noticed his account was locked.
After unlocking his account and updating GlobalProtect, he was able to connect to the VPN.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
First instinct was to have him install the most recent update via https://sslvpn.msoe.edu. GlobalProtect doesn't always function properly when it isn't updated.

While doing this, we noticed his account was locked.

After unlocking his account and updating GlobalProtect, he was able to connect to the VPN.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: AD to RE in Jenzabar
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hello IT, We are trying to schedule the newly arrived ESL students for registering in Jenzabar. Since the AD to RE process does not work for ESL, we switched the records to reflect an undergraduate major and start date that should work, but the records are not being picked up and sent to the registrar. (This is the same process that I have been doing for years and it usually works.) I am wondering if this process is not “turned on”. Thanks!
Mark Anderson Director of International Programs & Services andersonm@msoe.edu<mailto:andersonm@msoe.edu> 414.277.4544 Office 414.581.4457 Cell [MSOE]<https://www.msoe.edu/>
[FB]<https://www.facebook.com/milwaukeeschoolofengineering/>
[Twitter2]<https://twitter.com/MSOE_Admissions>
[Instagram2]<https://instagram.com/msoephoto/>
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Hello IT,
  We are trying to schedule the newly arrived ESL students for registering in Jenzabar.  Since the AD to RE process does not work for ESL, we switched the records to reflect an undergraduate major and start date that should work, but the records are not being picked up and sent to the registrar. (This is the same process that I have been doing for years and it usually works.)  I am wondering if this process is not “turned on”.
Thanks!
 
Mark Anderson
Director of International Programs & Services
andersonm@msoe.edu
414.277.4544 Office
414.581.4457 Cell

helpdesk-note.body: Sending to database team
helpdesk-note.body-html: Sending to database team

helpdesk-note.body: Spoke with Mark regarding the job. it is not ready for production use at this time so we talked through some alternate steps that the ESL team can take to get their students registered in the meantime. We will be meeting with Mark sometime next week to discuss the business logic of adding ESL to the process as well.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Spoke with Mark regarding the job. it is not ready for production use at this time so we talked through some alternate steps that the ESL team can take to get their students registered in the meantime.
We will be meeting with Mark sometime next week to discuss the business logic of adding ESL to the process as well.

helpdesk-note.body: Spoke with Mark regarding timing of updating process to include ESL and that it will be delayed until a new database person has been hired.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Spoke with Mark regarding timing of updating process to include ESL and that it will be delayed until a new database person has been hired.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Cannot use ID Card on Printers
helpdesk-ticket.description: Riley came to the desk and explained that he can't use his card to access the printers, but can enter his username and password to use the printers. Forwarding to the Card/Scheduling Team
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Riley came to the desk and explained that he can't use his card to access the printers, but can enter his username and password to use the printers. Forwarding to the Card/Scheduling Team

helpdesk-note.body: Forwarding to card team
helpdesk-note.body-html: Forwarding to card team

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Buolrg, Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4689
Riley came to the desk and explained that he can't use his card to access the printers, but can enter his username and password to use the printers. Forwarding to the Card/Scheduling Team
Anyone with new card since Dec. 12th will be denied at printers for prox read. We are working on the problem; the cause being a break in the interface between the ID card system and the print server. You can use your network userid/password to login for printing for now.
Sheila
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Buolrg,

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4689
Riley came to the desk and explained that he can't use his card to access the printers, but can enter his username and password to use the printers. Forwarding to the Card/Scheduling Team


Anyone with new card since Dec. 12th will be denied at printers for prox read.  We are working on the problem; the cause being a break in the interface between the ID card system and the print server.  You can use your network userid/password to login for printing for now. 

Sheila

helpdesk-note.body: Setting as resolved. New card users have been able to access printing since this incident.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Credential Login Issues
helpdesk-ticket.description: Elle Merrill left a voicemail reporting an inability to receive emails in Outlook and log in to Blackboard. I suspect the email connection issue is due to an expired email credential, due to her password being changed 2 days ago. The Blackboard issue might be due to the Blackboard redirect server still being down; she might be typing in the wrong URL. I called and left her a message asking her to call back so we could further troubleshoot the problem.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Fw: Account Disable Warning for Alex Carayannopoulos
helpdesk-ticket.description:
MSOE Helpdesk,
I have received the email below three times since mid December. Is this is a bogus email? What is 'fimservice@msoe.edu'?
I don't know why my accounts would be set to disable when I am a currently enrolled student. Also, It is well past december 20th and nothing seems to be disabled.
Any insight would be appreciated.
Thanks,
Alex Carayannopoulos
Student, B.S.E. Program
________________________________ From: fimservice@msoe.edu <fimservice@msoe.edu> Sent: Tuesday, December 22, 2015 1:00 AM To: Carayannopoulos, Alex; SysAdmin Subject: Account Disable Warning for Alex Carayannopoulos
Dear Alex,
Your MSOE accounts are set to disable on (01/20/2016). Please make sure you have all of your emails and files backed up as you will lose access to them once your account is disabled.
If you are an alumni, we encourage you to register for an alumni account through Google Apps by going to https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/.
MSOE Alumni Account Creation<https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/> gapps.msoe.edu MSOE is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission and a member of the North Central Association (800) 621-7440, (www.ncahlc.org). Additional program accreditation ...
If you would like to continue to follow MSOE on the Hub, please switch your Hub account from your MSOE account to a personal email address, or your alumni email address by going to http://hubswitcher.msoe.edu.
If you have any questions please contact the Help Desk by opening a ticket at http://helpdesk.msoe.edu or call 414-277-7288.
Thank You
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
MSOE Helpdesk,

I have received the email below three times since mid December. Is this is a bogus email? What is 'fimservice@msoe.edu'?

I don't know why my accounts would be set to disable when I am a currently enrolled student. Also, It is well past december 20th and nothing seems to be disabled.

Any insight would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Alex Carayannopoulos
Student, B.S.E. Program



From: fimservice@msoe.edu <fimservice@msoe.edu>
Sent: Tuesday, December 22, 2015 1:00 AM
To: Carayannopoulos, Alex; SysAdmin
Subject: Account Disable Warning for Alex Carayannopoulos
 
Dear Alex,
 
Your MSOE accounts are set to disable on (01/20/2016).  Please make sure you have all of your emails and files backed up as you will lose access to them once your account is disabled.
 
If you are an alumni, we encourage you to register for an alumni account through Google Apps by going to https://gapps.msoe.edu/alumni/.

If you have any questions please contact the Help Desk by opening a ticket at http://helpdesk.msoe.edu or call 414-277-7288.
 
Thank You

Can sys admin check and see if he is in the correct FIM group and send it back down to tier 1 if there's no problem

checked in DB and he is enrolled for 6 credits part time. Hmmm. He may have not been enrolled before the servers wen't down and then he started to get emails about his account being disabled. Just a theory.

helpdesk-note.body: His account will not be disabled. He got the email in December before FIM was updating from Jenzabar.

Hi Alex Carayannopoulos,
We have checked our database and your account will not be disabled. The emails you received were from back when our systems were not updated due to the crash. You do not need to worry about this. We will mark this issue resolved, if you don't have any further questions.
Thank you Rishabh Help Desk Technician
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi Alex Carayannopoulos,

We have checked our database and your account will not be disabled. The emails you received were from back when our systems were not updated due to the crash.
You do not need to worry about this. We will mark this issue resolved, if you don't have any further questions.

Thank you
Rishabh
Help Desk Technician

helpdesk-ticket.subject: FW: Voicemail Mailbox Quota Warning
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Hi all,
I tried logging into this page as instructed and I got a security error. Please advise.
Thanks, Diane
Diane H. Munzenmaier, PhD Program Director, Professional Development in STEM Education Center for BioMolecular Modeling, Milwaukee School of Engineering Milwaukee, WI 53202 414-277-2805 munzenmaier@msoe.edu http://cbm.msoe.edu/index.php
-----Original Message----- From: Cisco Unity Connection Messaging System [mailto:unityconnection@ucon01.msoe.edu] Sent: Monday, January 18, 2016 11:00 PM To: Munzenmaier, Diane Subject: Voicemail Mailbox Quota Warning Importance: High
Your voice mailbox has exceeded the quota warning threshold specified by your administrator.
Current Usage: 11.62 MB Quota Warning Threshold: 11.44 MB Quota Size Limit: 14.06 MB
Please reduce your voice mailbox size by deleting few items from your mailbox. The best way to do this is as follows:
1. Go to ciscovoicemail.msoe.edu in chrome 2. Click “advanced” and then “proceed to ucon…….” 3. Log in using your standard msoe domain credentials and your password. 4. Click web inbox 5. Select and delete all, or the majority, of the messages in your inbox, this will be a number of pages. 6. Then click the “deleted” button near the top left to see the deleted folder. 7. Then click “empty deleted items” in the upper right of the white window. 8. Give it a minute and it should clear up space. 9. You can dial *XXXX , where XXXX is your extension, and it will put you right into your voicemail so you can leave yourself a message to see for sure if it comes through.
If problems persist or you have issues logging into the web page, please call the helpdesk at 7288.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Comsol License Issue
helpdesk-ticket.description: Comsol was being used for Dr. Tritt's class today and when he was using it there was a message (will be attached once Dr. Tritt received this ticket) that notified him of a change in Comsol's license, which would allow only one user at a time. Is there a recent change to the Comsol license? This software will be used by his class in the immediate future and needs to be available to more than one user at a time. Please contact Dr. Tritt as soon as possible to make sure this issue is resolved.
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Comsol was being used for Dr. Tritt's class today and when he was using it there was a message (will be attached once Dr. Tritt received this ticket) that notified him of a change in Comsol's license, which would allow only one user at a time. Is there a recent change to the Comsol license? This software will be used by his class in the immediate future and needs to be available to more than one user at a time. Please contact Dr. Tritt as soon as possible to make sure this issue is resolved.

helpdesk-note.body: We got this problem solved based on some notes kept by the professor who taught this course last year. The installation script creates an incomplete shortcut to COMSOL. The fix is for students to manually edit the short cut to include the following at the end of the Target field (outside of the quotes): -ckl . This opens COMSOL in class kit mode which matches our license. Please update the installation script to correctly format the shortcut. You can test this by starting COMSOL after changing the shortcut. You should see an "Academic Version" message in the upper right of the splash screen. Let me know (x-7421) if you have any questions.
helpdesk-note.body-html:
We got this problem solved based on some notes kept by the professor who taught this course last year.

The installation script creates an incomplete shortcut to COMSOL. The fix is for students to manually edit the short cut to include the following at the end of the Target field (outside of the quotes): -ckl . This opens COMSOL in class kit mode which matches our license.

Please update the installation script to correctly format the shortcut. You can test this by starting COMSOL after changing the shortcut. You should see an "Academic Version" message in the upper right of the splash screen.

Let me know (x-7421) if you have any questions.

helpdesk-note.body:
Dr Tritt,
Thank you for letting us know about this issue! We are going to work on updating the installation script.
helpdesk-note.body-html:

Thank you for letting us know about this issue! We are going to work on updating the installation script.

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4750
Comsol was being used for Dr. Tritt's class today and when he was using it there was a message (will be attached once Dr. Tritt received this ticket) that notified him of a change in Comsol's license, which would allow only one user at a time. Is there a recent change to the Comsol license? This software will be used by his class in the immediate future and needs to be available to more than one user at a time. Please contact Dr. Tritt as soon as possible to make sure this issue is resolved.

helpdesk-note.body:
Here is what I told them (in a handout):
If you've not already done so, install COMSOL 5.1 from the network. To get started, follow the instructions at: https://community.msoe.edu/docs/DOC-5648 (How to Install Comsol). NOTE: these instructions are written for the installation of COMSOL 4.4 but also apply to 5.1. This is stated instructions, but repeated here for reference – use the <port number>@<host name> license format with port number 1719 and host name applicense2.msoe.edu. Use the defaults for the installation process. In addition to COMSOL the installation process also installs DirectX. The total installation process should take about 15 minutes.

these instructions are written for the installation of COMSOL 4.4 but also apply to 5.1. This is
stated instructions, but repeated here for reference – use the <port number>@<host name>
license format with port number 1719 and host name applicense2.msoe.edu. Use the defaults
for the installation process. In addition to COMSOL the installation process also installs DirectX.
The total installation process should take about 15 minutes.

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Dr. Tritt,
I have been unable to replicate your error that you have described in the ticket. I ran the install myself following the old 4.1 guide I posted to the MSOE HUB a while back. I could be looking in the wrong place but after the install, I ran the application and opened up the about section in Comsol Multi-physics. It still says that it is properly licensed and gives me the same access as what our license covers. In all honesty I could be wrong in my assessment, if you are willing to describe more of the problem first listed in the ticket I think that could help us in making a decision on whether or not we need to make changes to our installation files. For now though, if it's not broken, lets not try and fix it. However, you have a lot more experience than I do with Comsol and if the software has to be run as a Class Kit License then we will adapt to that.

Comsol was being used for Dr. Tritt's class today and when he was using it there was a message (will be attached once Dr. Tritt received this ticket) that notified him of a change in Comsol's license, which would allow only one user at a time. Is there a recent change to the Comsol license? This software will be used by his class in the immediate future and needs to be available to more than one user at a time. Please contact Dr. Tritt as soon as possible to make sure this issue is resolved.

helpdesk-note.body:
The problem is still occurring. I think what may be happening is that it is only an issue when more than one user tries to access COMSOL. If you’re doing your testing when my class is not running you won’t see it. Try installing and running COMSOL on two computers at the same time.
Earlier this week I had a student run into the problem and have to manually edit his shortcut (add the –ckl option).
Here is the text of the message I sent to the students after talking with Dr. LaMack and finding an e-mail from IT from last winter –
The installation script creates an incomplete shortcut to COMSOL. The fix is for students to manually edit the short cut to include the following at the end of the Target field (outside of the quotes): -ckl. This opens COMSOL in class kit mode which matches our license.
Please update the installation script to correctly format the shortcut. You can test this by starting COMSOL after changing the shortcut. You should see an "Academic Version" message in the upper right of the splash screen.
Let me know (x-7421) if you have any questions.
The -ckl starts COMSOL in class kit mode allowing multiple simultaneous users. Without it, the first student gets in and all the others are locked out.
Charles
helpdesk-note.body-html:
The problem is still occurring. I think what may be happening is that it is only an issue when more than one user tries to access COMSOL. If you’re doing your testing when my class is not running you won’t see it. Try installing and running COMSOL on two computers at the same time.
 
Earlier this week I had a student run into the problem and have to manually edit his shortcut (add the –ckl option).
 
Here is the text of the message I sent to the students after talking with Dr. LaMack and finding an e-mail from IT from last winter –
 
The installation script creates an incomplete shortcut to COMSOL. The fix is for students to manually edit the short cut to include the following at the end of the Target field (outside of the quotes): -ckl. This opens COMSOL in class kit mode which matches our license.
 
Please update the installation script to correctly format the shortcut. You can test this by starting COMSOL after changing the shortcut. You should see an "Academic Version" message in the upper right of the splash screen.
 
Let me know (x-7421) if you have any questions.
 
The -ckl starts COMSOL in class kit mode allowing multiple simultaneous users. Without it, the first student gets in and all the others are locked out.
 
Charles

Comsol was being used for Dr. Tritt's class today and when he was using it there was a message (will be attached once Dr. Tritt received this ticket) that notified him of a change in Comsol's license, which would allow only one user at a time. Is there a recent change to the Comsol license? This software will be used by his class in the immediate future and needs to be available to more than one user at a time. Please contact Dr. Tritt as soon as possible to make sure this issue is resolved.
 
 
 
 
On Thu, 28 Jan at 4:15 pm , Charles <tritt@msoe.edu> wrote:
The problem is still occurring. I think what may be happening is that it is only an issue when more than one user tries to access COMSOL. If you’re doing your testing when my class is not running you won’t see it. Try installing and running COMSOL on two computers at the same time.
 
Earlier this week I had a student run into the problem and have to manually edit his shortcut (add the –ckl option).
 
Here is the text of the message I sent to the students after talking with Dr. LaMack and finding an e-mail from IT from last winter –
 
The installation script creates an incomplete shortcut to COMSOL. The fix is for students to manually edit the short cut to include the following at the end of the Target field (outside of the quotes): -ckl. This opens COMSOL in class kit mode which matches our license.
 
Please update the installation script to correctly format the shortcut. You can test this by starting COMSOL after changing the shortcut. You should see an "Academic Version" message in the upper right of the splash screen.
 
Let me know (x-7421) if you have any questions.
 
The -ckl starts COMSOL in class kit mode allowing multiple simultaneous users. Without it, the first student gets in and all the others are locked out.
 
Charles
 
From: helpdesk [mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu]
Sent: Thursday, January 28, 2016 4:07 PM
To: Tritt, Dr. Charles <tritt@msoe.edu>
Subject: Re: [#INC-4750] Comsol License Issue
 
Hey Dr. Tritt,
 
I have been unable to replicate your error that you have described in the ticket. I ran the install myself following the old 4.1 guide I posted to the MSOE HUB a while back. I could be looking in the wrong place but after the install, I ran the application and opened up the about section in Comsol Multi-physics. It still says that it is properly licensed and gives me the same access as what our license covers. In all honesty I could be wrong in my assessment, if you are willing to describe more of the problem first listed in the ticket I think that could help us in making a decision on whether or not we need to make changes to our installation files. For now though, if it's not broken, lets not try and fix it. However, you have a lot more experience than I do with Comsol and if the software has to be run as a Class Kit License then we will adapt to that. 
 
 
Best Regards, 
Sam West
MSOE IT - Assistant Systems Administrator

On Fri, 22 Jan at 9:42 am , Charles <tritt@msoe.edu> wrote:
Here is what I told them (in a handout):
 
If you've not already done so, install COMSOL 5.1 from the network. To get started, follow the
instructions at: https://community.msoe.edu/docs/DOC-5648 (How to Install Comsol). NOTE:
these instructions are written for the installation of COMSOL 4.4 but also apply to 5.1. This is
stated instructions, but repeated here for reference – use the <port number>@<host name>
license format with port number 1719 and host name applicense2.msoe.edu. Use the defaults
for the installation process. In addition to COMSOL the installation process also installs DirectX.
The total installation process should take about 15 minutes.
 
[#INC-4750]
[#INC-4750]

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi Charles Tritt,
We have added a new installation to Get Programs called "Comsol 5.1 ClassKit." This will run an automated install of Comsol 5.1 and add the shortcut for Comsol 5.1 Classkit automatically. The shortcut will be named "Comsolckl" and it will be found on the user's desktop.
If your students already have Comsol 5.1 installed, either instruct them to uninstall Comsol and reinstall "Comsol 5.1 Classkit" or show them how to fix the shortcut manually. I really wish we could have put out a fix sooner so that way students don't have to go back and reinstall, but hopefully this will smooth things out for next quarter.
If you have any questions about this new installation, please feel free to let us know.

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Can't send emails through My.msoe to Students
helpdesk-ticket.assoc-problem: unable to email class lists in my.msoe
helpdesk-ticket.description: Dr. Abdelbaqi called in because he was getting and "Internal Server Error" message when attempting to send an email to the students in one of his classes through my.msoe.edu. He generally does not use his email often and is is unsure if his email in general has stopped working. I told him we would look into the issue and contact him back. - Tyler Clark
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: Dr. Abdelbaqi called in because he was getting and "Internal Server Error" message when attempting to send an email to the students in one of his classes through my.msoe.edu. He generally does not use his email often and is is unsure if his email in general has stopped working. I told him we would look into the issue and contact him back. - Tyler Clark

helpdesk-note.body:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors. As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:
Copy and paste the class roster from the my.msoe email and paste it into Outlook or Black Board and send email from there. This continues to leverage the up to date rosters from my.msoe but works around the email problem with a manual step.
I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.
I appreciate your patience and your time.
Peter Pfister Help Desk Coordinator 414.277.7202
helpdesk-note.body-html:
my.msoe email configuration is giving errors.  As IT continues to work to resolve this ongoing issue, please consider the following work around:

Copy and paste the class roster from the my.msoe email and paste it into Outlook or Black Board and send email from there.  This continues to leverage the up to date rosters from my.msoe but works around the email problem with a manual step.

I have marked this incident as pending a vendor response and I will update the incident again when we have a solution.

I appreciate your patience and your time.

Peter Pfister
Help Desk Coordinator
414.277.7202

If you believe that the ticket has not been resolved, please reply to this email to automatically reopen the ticket.
If there is no response from you, we will assume that the ticket has been resolved and the ticket will be automatically closed after 48 hours.

Sincerely,
MSOE IT SupportSupport Team
Please let us know your opinion on our support experience.

helpdesk-note.body: Hey Peter, can you please put this in the Maintenance queue?

helpdesk-note.body:
Hey Allison,
This is actually a maintenance problem. I know that IT and Maintenance seem related, but they are in fact different. Anyways, I went ahead and made a maintenance ticket for you. You should receive a notification about that being created.
I am going to close this ticket, as there is no follow up from our end needed.
Have a great day!

helpdesk-ticket.subject: Fwd: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link Help
helpdesk-ticket.description:
Paul Michael said he received this email a while ago but he lost it so I forwarded it to him. He is unable to log in following the instructions and gets the error in the attached screenshot.
Begin forwarded message:
From: "Michael, Paul" <michael@msoe.edu> Date: January 19, 2016 at 3:48:45 PM CST To: "Griffin, Abigail" <griffina@msoe.edu> Subject: RE: FW: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link
Hi! Sorry but I was unsuccessful in accessing Jenzabar. Could you please take a look at the attached screenshot and tell me what to do? Thanks, Paul
Paul Michael Research Chemist Fluid Power Institute Milwaukee School of Engineering 1025 N Broadway Milwaukee, WI 53202
O: 414.277.2238 C: 414.477.9530 michael@msoe.edu
From: Griffin, Abigail
Sent: Tuesday, January 19, 2016 3:37 PM To: Michael, Paul Subject: Fw: FW: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link
Hello,
Here is the email you should've received about the Jenzabar Cloud.
From: Thomas Schleich <thomasschleich34@gmail.com> Sent: Tuesday, January 19, 2016 3:24 PM To: Griffin, Abigail Subject: Fwd: FW: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link
---------- Forwarded message ---------- From: "Hurlbut, Patricia" <hurlbut@msoe.edu> Date: Jan 14, 2016 10:23 AM Subject: FW: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link To: "Schleich, Thomas" <schleicht@msoe.edu> Cc:
From: Tyriver, Beth
Sent: Wednesday, January 06, 2016 1:38 PM To: Pink, Victoria <pink@msoe.edu>; Shimek, Gary <shimek@msoe.edu>; Rowell, Sarah <rowell@msoe.edu>; Hurlbut, Patricia <hurlbut@msoe.edu>; diFilipo, Stephen <difilipo@msoe.edu>; Kerrigan, Timothy <kerrigan@msoe.edu>; Bynum, Susan <Bynum@msoe.edu>; Haugsland, Judith <haugsland@msoe.edu>; Varebrook, Catherine <varebroo@msoe.edu>; Fitzpatrick, Edward <fitzpatrick@msoe.edu>; Polaski, Daniel <polaski@msoe.edu>; Ferguson, Shawna <ferguson@msoe.edu>; Harris, Benjamin <harrisbj@msoe.edu>; Pfister, Peter <pfister@msoe.edu>; Fabian, Paul <fabian@msoe.edu>; Cottrill, Anthony <cottrilla@msoe.edu>; Miller, Brian <millerbj@msoe.edu>; Breese, Dr. William <breese@msoe.edu>; Gagliano, Richard <gagliano@msoe.edu>; Kamara, Sheku <kamara@msoe.edu> Subject: Jenzabar Cloud Login Instructions and Link
Hi Everyone,
The University has decided to move to a Jenzabar cloud hosted solution. This is a permanent move. In the simplest terms, this means that we will run our Jenzabar application on hardware hosted offsite by Jenzabar.
You are receiving this email because you have been given access to the Jenzabar cloud environment. Attached are instructions on how to log onto Jenzabar in the cloud. Your old method of logging into Jenzabar will not work.
You can expect some small difference working in the cloud environment. To help with login issues and other cloud related questions we will be offering walk in support, in room CC306 Enrollment Conference room, from 8am-5pm, on Tuesday January 5th and Wednesday January 6th .
Thank you!
Beth Tyriver
Database Analyst
Milwaukee School of Engineering
1025 N Broadway
Milwaukee, WI 53202-3109
414-277-7515
tyriver@msoe.edu
helpdesk-ticket.description-html:
Paul Michael said he received this email a while ago but he lost it so I forwarded it to him. He is unable to log in following the instructions and gets the error in the attached screenshot. 

Begin forwarded message:

From: "Michael, Paul" <michael@msoe.edu>
Date: January 19, 2016 at 3:48:45 PM CST
To: "Griffin, Abigail" <griffina@msoe.edu>

Hi Everyone,
 
The University has decided to move to a Jenzabar cloud hosted solution.  This is a permanent move.  In the simplest terms, this means that we will run our Jenzabar application on hardware hosted offsite by Jenzabar.
 
You are receiving this email because you have been given access to the Jenzabar cloud environment.  Attached are instructions on how to log onto Jenzabar in the cloud.  Your old method of logging into Jenzabar will not work. 
 
You can expect some small difference working in the cloud environment.  To help with login issues and other cloud related questions we will be offering walk in support, in room CC306 Enrollment Conference room, from 8am-5pm, on Tuesday January 5th and Wednesday January 6th .
 
Thank you!
Beth Tyriver
Database Analyst

1025 N Broadway
Milwaukee, WI  53202-3109

helpdesk-ticket.subject: I cannot view all of the members in my Office365 group
helpdesk-ticket.description: I use the Groups functionality of Office365 (on the school's exchange server) to maintain a mailing list for the student org MAGE. I have need to get all of the members that I have added to the group, but the members page only shows the first 100 members of the group. Is there any way I can get all of the members in my group?
helpdesk-ticket.description-html: I use the Groups functionality of Office365 (on the school's exchange server) to maintain a mailing list for the student org MAGE. I have need to get all of the members that I have added to the group, but the members page only shows the first 100 members of the group. Is there any way I can get all of the members in my group?

helpdesk-note.body:
Hi havemeyerd,
Thank you for contacting us. We will resolve this issue as soon as possible. Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4791 I use the Groups functionality of Office365 (on the school's exchange server) to maintain a mailing list for the student org MAGE. I have need to get all of the members that I have added to the group, but the members page only shows the first 100 members of the group. Is there any way I can get all of the members in my group?
helpdesk-note.body-html:
Hi havemeyerd,

Thank you for contacting us. We will resolve this issue as soon as possible.

Issue: http://helpdesk.msoe.edu/helpdesk/tickets/4791
I use the Groups functionality of Office365 (on the school's exchange server) to maintain a mailing list for the student org MAGE. I have need to get all of the members that I have added to the group, but the members page only shows the first 100 members of the group. Is there any way I can get all of the members in my group?

helpdesk-note.body: Sent to System Admin.
helpdesk-note.body-html: Sent to System Admin.

helpdesk-note.body: Michael what steps did you take to assist him in viewing his member list? Did you assist him in webmail or the Outlook client?
helpdesk-note.body-html: Michael what steps did you take to assist him in viewing his member list?  Did you assist him in webmail or the Outlook client?

helpdesk-note.body:
i check the OWA support forums and it looks like there is a limit of 100 people on the list that is shown but not for the number of people that can be in the group.
try clicking Get-GroupMailbox -IncludeMembers that should show all users in the group
helpdesk-note.body-html:
i check the OWA support forums and it looks like there is a limit of 100 people on the list that is shown but not for the number of people that can be in the group.

try clicking
Get-GroupMailbox -IncludeMembers
that should show all users in the group
